ticket.title: Specifying id in routes
ticket.original-body:
I am trying to specify the id parameter in the new routes interface.
An example use is if I have a table of pages in a database, and I want to give one a fixed url, pointing to the standard show method with the entry's id.
So, if I want a one-off route for the privacy policy page (e.g. page 10), I would ideally want a route like this: @@@ ruby match "/privacy" => "pages#show#10", :as => "privacy_page" @@@
The next best case would be: @@@ ruby match "/privacy" => "pages#show", :as => "privacy_page", :defaults => {:id => 10} @@@
However, neither of these work and I am having to resort to: @@@ ruby match "/privacy(/:id)" => "pages#show", :as => "privacy_page", :defaults => {:id => 10} @@@
I've looked through the source and don't think I'm missing anything obvious.
Thanks, iHiD

version.title: Specifying id in routes

version.body:
Works as expected for me in 3.0.0:
@@@ ruby
# Explicit match '/privacy', :to => 'pages#show', :as => :privacy, :via => :get, :defaults => { :id => 10 }
# Shorthand get '/privacy' => 'pages#show', :id => 10
@@@
iHiD, can you confirm that it's fixed for you?
version.body-html:
Works as expected for me in 3.0.0:


  # Explicit
  match '/privacy', :to => 'pages#show', :as => :privacy, :via => :get, :defaults => { :id => 10 }

  # Shorthand
  get '/privacy' => 'pages#show', :id => 10

iHiD, can you confirm that it's fixed for you?
